‍ADOPT.Defintion: to accept or start to use something new

‍AFRESH.Defintion: if you do something afresh, you deal with it again in a new way

‍ARCHAIC.Defintion: of or belonging to an ancient period in history

‍ARISTOCRATIC.Defintion: a class of people who hold high social rank

‍BINGE.Defintion: an occasion when an activity is done in an extreme way, especially eating, drinking, or spending money

‍BIOGRAPHY.Defintion: the life story of a person written by someone else

‍BOXING DAY.Defintion: in the UK and some other countries, the day after Christmas Day, which is a public holiday

‍BUCKET LIST.Defintion: a list of the things that a person would like to do or achieve before they die

‍COMMITMENT.Defintion: willingness to give your time and energy to a job, activity, or something that you believe in

‍EARL.Defintion: (the title of) a British man of high social rank, between a marquis and a viscount

‍FILLINGS.Defintion: the layer of food inside a sandwich, cake, etc

‍FIRST MEN.Defintion: important men, likely aristocrats or rich men

‍FOR THAT MATTER.Defintion: used to show that a statement is true in another situation, e.g. Ming's never been to Spain, or to any European country for that matter.

‍FOR WANT OF.Defintion: because of not having (something) because (something) does not exist or is not available

‍FOUNDING FATHERS.Defintion: one of a group of men who started the United States as a country and wrote its constitution

‍GASTRONOMY.Defintion: the art and knowledge involved in preparing and eating good food

‍GENIUS.Defintion: a person with very great and rare natural ability or skill, especially in a particular area such as science or art

‍HIT.Defintion: a thing or person that is very popular or successful

‍ICONIC.Defintion: very famous or popular, especially being considered to represent particular opinions or a particular time

‍LEFTOVER.Defintion: a leftover part of something is the part that has not been used or eaten when the other parts have been

‍LIKELIHOOD.Defintion: the chance that something will happen

‍LOCK IN.Defintion: to get and keep an advantage such as a low price

‍MEZZE.Defintion: a selection of small dishes served as appetizers in parts of the Middle East, the Balkans, Turkey, Greece, and North Africa

‍NOTABLE.Defintion: important and deserving attention , because of being very good or interesting

‍NOWADAYS.Defintion: at the present time, in comparison to the past:

‍OUT OF THIN AIR.Defintion: from nothing, e.g. 'I can't come up with €10,000 out of thin air.'

‍PARDON.Defintion: to forgive someone for something they have said or done. This word is often used in polite expressions

‍PERUSE.Defintion: to read through something, especially in order to find the part you are interested in

‍PLATTERS.Defintion: a large plate used for serving food or a meal with one type of food served on a large plate

‍PREDATE.Defintion: to have existed or happened before another thing

‍PUN.Defintion: a funny use of a word or phrase that has several meanings or that sounds like another word

‍REPUTATION.Defintion: the opinion that people in general have about someone or something, or how much respect or admiration someone or something receives , based on past behaviour or character

‍SALES PITCH.Defintion: a talk or a way of talking that is intended to persuade you to buy something

‍SANDWICHED.Defintion: to put something or someone in a small space between two other, usually bigger, things or people

‍SERIAL.Defintion: used to describe someone who does something several times or repeatedly

‍SOGGY.Defintion: (of things that can absorb water , especially food ) unpleasantly wet and soft

SOJOURN.Defintion: a temporary stay, e.g. 'her sojourn in Rome'.

‍THE BEST THING SINCE SLICED BREAD.Defintion: the best and most useful innovation or development invented for a long time

‍TOOK OFF.Defintion: to suddenly start to be successful or popular

‍TRAVEL HACK.Defintion: clever solution for a travel related problem

‍UPHOLD.Defintion: to defend or keep a principle or law

‍WRAPPED.Defintion: covered with paper or other material

‍WRAPPED UP.Defintion: to cover or surround something in paper, cloth, or other material
